body_html: Pushing it down to the C++ level would be harder, because it's hard to choose the "no padding" value if it's just an int. You either need an extra flag, or choose INT_MIN or INT_MAX, but these are annoying to get from Python
body_text: Pushing it down to the C++ level would be harder, because it's hard to choose the "no padding" value if it's just an int. You either need an extra flag, or choose INT_MIN or INT_MAX, but these are annoying to get from Python
body: Pushing it down to the C++ level would be harder, because it's hard to choose the "no padding" value if it's just an `int`. You either need an extra flag, or choose `INT_MIN` or `INT_MAX`, but these are annoying to get from Python
